results.title: Done Bali
results.creator_credit: Negara Productions, Kerry Negara, Tony Chapman and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: This program looks at the history of Bali, including the commercialisation of it’s culture, tourism and the impact of Western influences upon such things as education. It examines the role played by tourism as an agent of change, and questions the inevitability of change upon this small island.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Negara Productions, Kerry Negara, Tony Chapman and Paul Cox

results.title: Donatello 1386-1466: the first modern sculptor
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Donatello is said in this documentary to be the most versatile and imaginative of all artists of his century and he is credited with bringing the Renaissance to Italy. The intense and personal work of Donatello is examined here in terms of his vision, emotion and techniques. Most notable is his inventive techniques in his work such as was used in his relief making sculpture. Writer and art historian Charles Avery locates an obscure terra-cotta relief of Donatello’s in Florence and throughout the documentary the authentication of the work is shown. Avery discusses the work of Donatello along with sculptors Henry Moore, Elisabeth Frink, and Peter Rockwell. This documentary was made shortly after the restoration of a number of significant works by Donatello and is the first time that these works can be seen in their former glory revealing a brilliance in colour and detail not seen in recent history.

results.title: Donald in Mathmagic land
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Donald Duck participates in a remarkable adventure and learns that music, architecture, art and science are all based on mathematical principles. Tracing the history and development of these principles, we find the Arabs responsible for our present numbers and algebra; Egypt the source of geometric theories, the pyramids remaining as a monument to their knowledge of the triangle; and to the Greeks Pythagoras we owe our musical scale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske

results.title: Donald Brittain: filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Adam Symansky, ONF | NFB and Kent Martin
results.brief_description: Donald Brittain was one of the most respected documentary filmmakers of his time and his work with the National Film Board of Canada earned him accolades from his peers and cemented his place in cinema history. This documentary examines the man behind the work and the work itself. He created films about heroes, “exposed villians” and offered filmgoers a “warts and all” expose of his subject and themes. This excellent documentary presents a frank and honest account of Brittain whose gift is described as being able to make the great man common and the common man great.

results.title: Donald and the wheel
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Donald Duck accidently invents the wheel. Later Egyptians, Greek, Romans and others improve on it. Through songs and commentary the possible history of the wheel is traced. Donald, however, is not very impressed, particularly the aspect of the chaos of modern traffic.
results.description: Donald Duck accidently invents the wheel. Later Egyptians, Greek, Romans and others improve on it. Through songs and commentary the possible history of the wheel is traced. Donald, however, is not very impressed, particularly the aspect of the chaos of modern traffic.

results.title: Donald's fire survival plan (K)
results.creator_credit: Ken Peterson, Walt Disney Productions and Les Clark
results.brief_description: The need for a fire survival plan in the home. Every day over 1500 homes burn, and 18 lives are lost, one third of them children. Schools, industrial plants and public buildings practise proper procedures, why not homes? Donald Duck works out a plan to protect his family in case of fire.

results.title: Donald's crime (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and Jack King
results.brief_description: A Donald Duck cartoon made at the peak of the series’ popularity, and an outstanding use of the medium to explore the psychology of guilt. Donald Duck needs money to take his girlfriend, Daisy, to a dance, so he steals his nephews’ piggy bank. Tormented by guilt, Donald returns the money before his nephews discover what has happened.
